greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Fibonacci binary constant: Sum{i>=0} (1/2)^Fibonacci(i).
comment: This constant is transcendental, see A084119. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 12 2014
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
D. H. Bailey, J. M. Borwein, R. E. Crandall and C. Pomerance, On the binary expansions of algebraic numbers, Journal de Théorie des Nombres de Bordeaux 16 (2004), 487-518. LBNL-53854.
mathematica: RealDigits[ N[ Sum[(1/2)^Fibonacci[i], {i, 0, Infinity}], 111]][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 26 2006 *)
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 20080); x=suminf(k=0, 1/2^fibonacci(k)); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b124091.txt", n, " ", d)) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, May 04 2009
xref: Equals A084119 + 1. Cf. A007404 (Kempner-Mahler number); continued fraction, A125600.
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 25 2006
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 26 2006
